name: Bruno
tagline: Open-source, privacy-first API client for developers
description: Bruno is an open-source API client designed for Windows 10/11, focusing on privacy and local-first workflows. It replaces cloud-dependent tools with file-based collections (stored as folders/files on your system) for REST, GraphQL, and gRPC APIs. Features include intuitive request building, environment variables, dark/light mode sync with Windows themes, and support for OAuth2, JWT, and API keys. Integrates seamlessly with Windows File Explorer (associates .bru files) and can be installed via winget or official EXE. No mandatory cloud sync—keep your API data local and secure, with optional Bruno Hub for team collaboration.
key_features: Privacy-first local API collections (no default cloud sync)
Supports REST, GraphQL, and gRPC APIs
Native Windows integration (winget install, file associations)
pros: Open-source and completely free (no paid tiers)
Dark/light mode sync with Windows system themes
cons: Smaller plugin ecosystem compared to Postman
Limited enterprise collaboration features
No built-in cloud sync (optional via Bruno Hub with basic functionality)

faqs.question: Is Bruno compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, Bruno runs natively on Windows 11 (and Windows 10) with full support for system features like theme sync and file associations.

faqs.question: Is it safe to install?
faqs.answer: Yes—Bruno is open-source (code hosted on GitHub) and distributed via official channels (EXE installer, winget). It has no malicious code or hidden tracking.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version?
faqs.answer: Yes! Bruno offers a portable ZIP download for Windows, allowing you to run it from a USB drive or external storage without installation.

name: Hoppscotch
tagline: Lightweight API testing tool for Windows developers
description: Hoppscotch is an open-source, modern API client designed for Windows developers to test and debug APIs quickly. It integrates smoothly with Windows OS—supporting system shortcuts, dark mode alignment with Windows settings, and native installation via Microsoft Store or portable version. Features include REST/GraphQL/WebSocket support, environment variables, offline functionality, and minimal resource usage. Ideal for Windows users seeking a fast, lightweight alternative to heavy API clients, it lets you send requests, inspect responses, and manage API workflows efficiently without compromising performance.
cons: Limited advanced features (e.g., automated test suites) compared to premium tools
No built-in team collaboration in the desktop version
Less extensive documentation than some competitors

faqs.question: Is Hoppscotch compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, Hoppscotch works seamlessly with Windows 11. It supports native installation via the Microsoft Store and aligns with Windows 11’s design guidelines, including dark mode and system shortcut integration.

faqs.question: Is it safe to install?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Hoppscotch is open-source (hosted on GitHub) with a transparent codebase. You can install it via the official Microsoft Store or download the portable version from its website—both options are secure and free of malware.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version?
faqs.answer: Yes, Hoppscotch offers a portable version for Windows. You can download it from the official website, unzip it, and run it without any installation—perfect for using on multiple devices without admin rights.

name: HTTP Toolkit
tagline: Intercept, inspect, and debug HTTP(S) traffic for Windows API development
description: HTTP Toolkit is a essential tool for Windows API developers, enabling interception and analysis of HTTP/HTTPS traffic from any app—browsers, desktop tools, CLI, and more. It integrates with Windows' network stack for easy setup, supports TLS decryption via local root certificates, and offers a clean interface to inspect headers, payloads, response times, and WebSocket messages. You can mock responses, throttle connections, and export data for debugging. Works seamlessly with Windows 10/11, integrates with VS Code, and has free/pro tiers for basic or advanced use cases.
key_features: Intercept HTTP(S) traffic from any Windows application
Mock API responses and throttle network connections
Inspect detailed request/response data (headers, payloads, TLS) and WebSockets
pros: Easy setup with native Windows network integration
Free tier available for basic debugging needs
cons: Advanced features (team collaboration, custom scripts) locked behind Pro plan
Requires local root certificate installation for TLS decryption

faqs.question: Is HTTP Toolkit compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, HTTP Toolkit fully supports Windows 11, as well as Windows 10. It leverages Windows' network capabilities to intercept traffic from all apps without compatibility issues.

faqs.question: Is it safe to install?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. HTTP Toolkit generates a local root certificate for TLS decryption (never shared externally), and its core is open-source. It does not collect or share your traffic data with third parties.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version?
faqs.answer: Currently, HTTP Toolkit does not offer an official portable version for Windows. The installer is required to set up necessary components for traffic interception and OS integration.

name: Insomnia
tagline: Simplify API testing and design for Windows developers
description: Insomnia is a native Windows API client that streamlines testing, designing, and debugging REST, GraphQL, and gRPC APIs. It offers intuitive tools like auto-completion for requests, environment variable management, and real-time response previews. Native Windows integration includes dark/light mode sync with system settings, toast notifications for long-running requests, and compatibility with WSL for testing local Linux-hosted APIs. Collaborate via shared workspaces and export collections to sync across devices, making it ideal for individual developers and teams alike.
key_features: Environment variable management for dynamic requests
pros: Native Windows notifications and theme integration

Steeper learning curve for beginners

faqs.answer: Yes, Insomnia is fully compatible with Windows 11, including support for snap layouts, system theme sync, and native toast notifications.

faqs.answer: Absolutely—Insomnia is open-source with a trusted community. It’s available via official channels like its website and Windows Store, ensuring secure, malware-free installations.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version?
faqs.answer: Yes, Insomnia offers a portable build that runs from USB drives or external storage without installation, perfect for on-the-go API testing.

description: Figma is a cloud-powered graphic design tool tailored for Windows 10/11, enabling real-time collaboration on UI/UX designs, illustrations, and interactive prototypes. It integrates seamlessly with Windows features like touch inputs, high-DPI displays, system shortcuts, and taskbar notifications. Users can work offline with automatic sync when online, export assets in PNG/SVG/PDF formats, and leverage component libraries for consistent design. Windows-specific optimizations enhance workflow efficiency, while cloud storage ensures access to files across devices. Ideal for teams and individuals, it combines vector editing, prototyping, and collaboration in one intuitive interface.

cons: Requires internet for full collaboration
Free plan has limited cloud storage (2GB)
Advanced features locked behind paid tiers
Occasional lag on older Windows devices

faqs.question: Is Figma compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, Figma is fully compatible with Windows 11, supporting high-DPI displays, touch inputs, snap layouts, and taskbar notification integration for an optimized experience.

faqs.question: Is it safe to install?
faqs.answer: Yes, Figma’s Windows app is safe to install. It is available via the official Figma website and Microsoft Store, with encrypted data transmission and optional two-factor authentication for account security.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version?
faqs.answer: No, Figma does not offer a portable version for Windows. However, its cloud-based architecture allows users to access their designs from any Windows device by logging into their account, with offline work support.

name: GIMP
tagline: Powerful free open-source image editor for Windows
description: GIMP is a professional-grade, free image editor for Windows 10/11. It offers layers, masks, retouching tools, custom brushes, and PSD compatibility—ideal for photo editing, graphic design, and digital art. It integrates with Windows File Explorer for quick edits, supports high-DPI displays, and works with common formats like PNG and JPG. Open-source, it’s customizable via plugins, and its interface scales to different screen sizes, making it accessible for both beginners and experts on Windows devices.

Professional photo retouching and manipulation tools

Portable version available via trusted platforms
cons: Steeper learning curve for beginners
Interface feels clunky compared to paid alternatives

faqs.question: Is GIMP compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, GIMP fully supports Windows 11, including optimized performance for modern hardware and high-DPI displays.

faqs.question: Is it safe to install?
faqs.answer: Absolutely—downloading GIMP from its official website (gimp.org) is safe. As open-source software, its code is publicly audited for security.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version?
faqs.answer: Yes, portable builds are available via platforms like PortableApps.com, allowing you to run GIMP from a USB drive without installing it on Windows.

It integrates with the Windows context menu for right-click compression, works seamlessly with Windows 10/11, maintains EXIF metadata, and processes images quickly—ideal for web developers, designers, or anyone needing smaller PNG files for faster loading.

description: mRemoteNG is a feature-rich remote connection manager for Windows, enabling users to manage multiple remote sessions across protocols like RDP, VNC, SSH, Telnet, and HTTP(S) from a single interface. It offers a hierarchical tree view to organize connections, secure credential storage with AES encryption, and tabbed sessions for seamless switching. Integrations include Windows Credential Manager support, drag-and-drop tab rearrangement, and customizable UI themes, making it ideal for admins to simplify diverse remote environment management.

Hierarchical tree view for organizing connections
Secure credential storage with AES encryption
Tabbed interface for simultaneous remote sessions
pros: Wide range of supported remote protocols
cons: Outdated UI design compared to modern tools
No built-in cloud sync for connections
Steeper learning curve for new users

faqs.question: Is mRemoteNG compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, mRemoteNG is fully compatible with Windows 11, along with Windows 10, 8.1, and 7 (both 32-bit and 64-bit versions).

faqs.question: Is it safe to install?
faqs.answer: Yes, mRemoteNG is an open-source tool with transparent code. It uses AES encryption for credential storage and is trusted by admins—always download from the official website to avoid security risks.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version?
faqs.answer: Yes, mRemoteNG offers a portable version that requires no installation. You can run it directly from a USB drive or local folder for on-the-go remote management.

name: MTPuTTY
tagline: Tabbed SSH client for Windows with session management
description: MTPuTTY is a free tabbed interface wrapper for PuTTY, enabling users to manage multiple SSH sessions in one window. It integrates seamlessly with Windows, supporting drag-and-drop session arrangement, encrypted saved credentials, and system tray access. Features include session grouping, customizable hotkeys, and compatibility with PuTTY’s config files. It eliminates cluttered windows, letting users switch sessions instantly. Ideal for admins/developers, it leverages Windows UI conventions for intuitive use, boosting productivity with remote server management tasks.

cons: No native SFTP support (relies on PuTTY’s PSCP)
Outdated UI compared to modern terminal clients

faqs.question: Is MTPuTTY compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, MTPuTTY works smoothly on Windows 11, as well as Windows 7, 8, and 10, with no additional dependencies beyond PuTTY.

faqs.question: Is it safe to install?
faqs.answer: Yes, MTPuTTY is safe if downloaded from its official website. It uses encryption for saved credentials and does not contain malware.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version?
faqs.answer: Yes, MTPuTTY offers a portable version that requires no installation—just extract the files and run, making it ideal for USB drives or shared computers.

name: PuTTY
tagline: Lightweight SSH and telnet client for Windows
description: PuTTY is a free, open-source terminal emulator for Windows supporting SSH, telnet, rlogin, and raw socket connections. It integrates seamlessly with Windows systems, offering customizable session management (save/load remote connections), SSH key support, and terminal appearance tweaks (fonts, color schemes). Included tools like PuTTYgen (key generation) and Pageant (SSH agent) fit native Windows workflows. Lightweight and fast, it’s ideal for admins/developers to connect securely to remote servers. Compatible with Windows 7-11, it also has a portable version for on-the-go use without installation.

SSH key generation (PuTTYgen) and agent support (Pageant)

Widely trusted and used by system admins/developers
cons: Outdated user interface (UI) compared to modern terminals
No native tab support (requires third-party add-ons)
Lacks built-in file transfer (needs PSCP or WinSCP separately)
Steeper learning curve for SSH key management for new users

faqs.question: Is PuTTY compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, PuTTY is fully compatible with Windows 11, as well as Windows 10, 8, and 7.

It supports dynamic tiling layouts (vertical, horizontal, grid) and workspace organization, integrating seamlessly with the Windows shell—so users retain access to their desktop, taskbar, and native features. Key features include multi-monitor support, snap assist enhancement, and customizable Lua config files for tailoring layouts/shortcuts. Lightweight and open-source, it lets users toggle tiling mode on/off to switch between tiled and floating workflows, ideal for power users boosting productivity without replacing their Windows environment.
key_features: Seamless Windows shell integration and multi-monitor support
pros: Open-source and completely free to use
Lightweight with minimal system resource usage
Works alongside native Windows features (no shell replacement)
Toggle tiling mode easily for flexible workflows
cons: No graphical configuration tool (requires editing Lua files)
Steep learning curve for users new to tiling managers
Limited official documentation for advanced customization

faqs.question: Is Komorebi compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, Komorebi fully supports Windows 11, including its native shell features, taskbar, and multi-monitor setups. It integrates smoothly without disrupting existing Windows 11 workflows.

faqs.question: Is it safe to install?
faqs.answer: Yes, Komorebi is an open-source project hosted on GitHub, so its source code is publicly auditable. It contains no malicious components or ads, making it safe for installation.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version?
faqs.answer: Yes, Komorebi offers a portable executable that can be run directly without installation. This allows users to use it from a USB drive or across multiple devices without modifying system settings.

name: GlazeWM
tagline: A tiling window manager for Windows with keyboard-driven productivity
description: GlazeWM is a lightweight, open-source tiling window manager for Windows 10/11, enabling efficient window organization via layouts like vertical, horizontal, and grid. It prioritizes keyboard shortcuts for resizing, moving, and switching windows, reducing mouse dependency. The tool supports multi-monitor setups with per-display configurations and floating windows for non-tiling apps. Customizable via JSON/YAML files, it integrates smoothly with native Windows features (taskbar, system tray) while boosting productivity for power users.
cons: Steep learning curve for new users
No GUI for configuration (text files only)
Limited advanced documentation
Occasional compatibility with fullscreen apps

faqs.question: Is GlazeWM compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, GlazeWM is fully compatible with Windows 11 and Windows 10, integrating smoothly with native OS features like multi-monitor support and high-DPI displays.

faqs.question: Is it safe to install?
faqs.answer: Yes, GlazeWM is open-source software with publicly auditable code on GitHub. It has no malware or adware, making it safe to install from the official repository.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version?
faqs.answer: Yes, GlazeWM offers a portable executable. Download the zip from GitHub releases, extract it, and run directly without system installation.

name: PartitionGuru ｜ Eassos Recovery
tagline: Comprehensive data recovery & partition management tool for Windows
description: PartitionGuru | Eassos Recovery is a versatile Windows tool combining data recovery and partition management. It recovers lost/deleted files from hard drives, SSDs, USBs, SD cards, and formatted/corrupted partitions. Supports Windows file systems (NTFS, FAT32, exFAT, HFS+) and works with GPT/MBR disks. Features include partition resize, create, delete without data loss, file preview before recovery, and RAW drive recovery. Compatible with Windows 11,10, and older versions, integrating seamlessly with Windows storage architecture for efficient operations.
key_features: Recover data from formatted/corrupted partitions and storage devices
Manage partitions (resize, create, delete) without data loss
Preview files before recovery to confirm recoverability
pros: Supports multiple file systems and disk types (GPT/MBR)
Compatible with all recent Windows versions (11/10/8/7)
cons: Free version has recovery size limits
Interface lacks modern design
Advanced features require a paid license

faqs.question: Is PartitionGuru | Eassos Recovery compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, it fully supports Windows 11, along with Windows 10, 8.1, 8,7, Vista, and XP.

faqs.question: Is it safe to install?
faqs.answer: Yes, PartitionGuru | Eassos Recovery is a legitimate tool from Eassos Technology. Ensure you download it from the official website to avoid malicious versions.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version?
faqs.answer: Yes, a portable version is available, allowing you to run the tool without installation on any Windows device.

name: Nirsoft Utilities Suite
tagline: Comprehensive collection of free Windows system utilities
description: Nirsoft Utilities Suite offers over 200 lightweight, ad-free tools for Windows, covering system diagnostics, network monitoring, data recovery, and password management. Tools integrate seamlessly with Windows 10/11 via native APIs, requiring no installation (portable) and avoiding bloatware. Ideal for power users and techs, utilities like ProcessActivityView (system process tracker) and Recuva alternative UndeletePlus fill gaps in default Windows tools, providing deep insights into system operations without compromising performance. Each tool is standalone, so you only use what you need.
key_features: Covers diagnostics, recovery, and network tasks
Native Windows API integration for efficiency
cons: No unified launcher for all tools
Some tools have basic UI (no modern design)
Antivirus may flag tools as PUPs (false positives)

faqs.question: Is Nirsoft Utilities Suite compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, most Nirsoft tools work fully with Windows 11, as they leverage native Windows APIs supported across recent versions.

faqs.question: Is it safe to install?
faqs.answer: Absolutely—all Nirsoft tools are malware-free. Some antivirus programs may flag them as PUPs due to their utility nature (e.g., password recovery), but they are safe to use.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version?
faqs.answer: All Nirsoft tools are portable by default—no installation is required, and they can be run directly from a USB drive or any folder on your Windows PC.

name: VLC Media Player
tagline: Versatile, ad-free media player for Windows supporting all formats
description: VLC Media Player is a free, open-source video utility for Windows that plays virtually all audio/video formats (MP4, MKV, AVI, FLAC, etc.) without extra codecs. It integrates seamlessly with Windows File Explorer (right-click playback), supports DVD/Blu-ray playback, media streaming, and subtitle sync. For Windows 10/11, it offers hardware acceleration for smooth 4K/HDR playback, customizable skins to match OS themes, and media conversion/stream recording tools. Lightweight and reliable, it’s a go-to choice for hassle-free media playback on Windows.
key_features: Plays all major media formats without additional codecs
Seamless Windows integration (File Explorer context menu, hardware acceleration)
Supports streaming, DVD/Blu-ray playback, and media conversion
pros: 100% free and open-source (no ads or malware)
Low resource usage for high-definition content
Cross-platform compatibility with Windows, macOS, and Linux
cons: Outdated default interface (skins available but limited)
Advanced settings may overwhelm casual users
Lacks robust built-in media library management

faqs.question: Is VLC Media Player compatible with Windows 11?
faqs.answer: Yes, VLC is fully compatible with Windows 11, including support for hardware acceleration of 4K/HDR videos and integration with the OS’s context menu and taskbar features.

faqs.question: Is it safe to install?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. VLC is developed by the non-profit VideoLAN organization and is open-source—its code is publicly audited. Official downloads from videolan.org are free of adware, malware, or bloatware.

faqs.question: Is there a portable version?
faqs.answer: Yes, VLC offers an official portable edition that runs directly from a USB drive without installation. It retains all core features and works on any Windows PC without leaving traces.

Specialized utilities for password recovery & diagnostics

faqs.answer: All Nirsoft utilities are portable by default—no installation required. You can run them directly from any folder, USB drive, or external storage device.
